BootDiagnosticsInfoPatchProperties.description:
Boot Diagnostics is a debugging feature which allows you to view Console Output and Screenshot to diagnose VM status.

You can easily view the output of your console log.

Azure also enables you to see a screenshot of the VM from the hypervisor

enabled.description: Whether boot diagnostics should be enabled on the Virtual Machine.

storageUri.description:
Uri of the storage account to use for placing the console output and screenshot.

If storageUri is not specified while enabling boot diagnostics, managed storage will be used.

HealthCheckName.description: Represents the name of the health check operation performed.

values.name: DomainJoinedCheck
values.description: Verifies the SessionHost is joined to a domain. If this check fails is classified as fatal as no connection can succeed if the SessionHost is not joined to the domain. (Currently Enabled)

values.name: DomainTrustCheck
values.description: Verifies the SessionHost is not experiencing domain trust issues that will prevent authentication on SessionHost at connection time when session is created. If this check fails is classified as fatal as no connection can succeed if we cannot reach the domain for authentication on the SessionHost. (Currently Enabled)

values.name: FSLogixHealthCheck
values.description: Verifies the FSLogix service is up and running to make sure users' profiles are loaded in the session. If this check fails is classified as fatal as even if the connection can succeed, user experience is bad as the user profile cannot be loaded and user will get a temporary profile in the session. (Currently Disabled)

values.name: SxSStackListenerCheck
values.description: Verifies that the SxS stack is up and running so connections can succeed. If this check fails is classified as fatal as no connection can succeed if the SxS stack is not ready. (Currently Enabled)

values.name: UrlsAccessibleCheck
values.description: Verifies that the required WVD service and Geneva URLs are reachable from the SessionHost. These URLs are: RdTokenUri, RdBrokerURI, RdDiagnosticsUri and storage blob URLs for agent monitoring (geneva). If this check fails, it is non fatal and the machine still can service connections, main issue may be that monitoring agent is unable to store warm path data (logs, operations ...). (Currently Disabled)

values.name: MonitoringAgentCheck
values.description: Verifies that the required Geneva agent is running. If this check fails, it is non fatal and the machine still can service connections, main issue may be that monitoring agent is missing or running (possibly) older version. (Currently Enabled)

values.name: DomainReachable
values.description: Verifies the domain the SessionHost is joined to is still reachable. If this check fails is classified as fatal as no connection can succeed if the domain the SessionHost is joined is not reachable at the time of connection. (Currently Disabled)

values.name: WebRTCRedirectorCheck
values.description: Verifies whether the WebRTCRedirector component is healthy. The WebRTCRedirector component is used to optimize video and audio performance in Microsoft Teams. This checks whether the component is still running, and whether there is a higher version available. If this check fails, it is non fatal and the machine still can service connections, main issue may be the WebRTCRedirector component has to be restarted or updated. (Currently Disabled)

values.name: SupportedEncryptionCheck
values.description: Verifies the value of SecurityLayer registration key. If the value is 0 (SecurityLayer.RDP) this check fails with Error code = NativeMethodErrorCode.E_FAIL and is fatal. If the value is 1 (SecurityLayer.Negotiate) this check fails with Error code = NativeMethodErrorCode.ERROR_SUCCESS and is non fatal. (Currently Disabled)

values.name: MetaDataServiceCheck
values.description: Verifies the metadata service is accessible and return compute properties. (Currently Enabled)

values.name: AppAttachHealthCheck
values.description: Verifies that the AppAttachService is healthy (there were no issues during package staging). The AppAttachService is used to enable the staging/registration (and eventual de-registration/destaging) of MSIX apps that have been set up by the tenant admin. This checks whether the component had any failures during package staging. Failures in staging will prevent some MSIX apps from working properly for the end user. If this check fails, it is non fatal and the machine still can service connections, main issue may be certain apps will not work for end-users. (Currently Enabled)

values.description: Health check result is not currently known.

values.name: HealthCheckSucceeded
values.description: Health check passed.

values.name: HealthCheckFailed
values.description: Health check failed.

values.name: SessionHostShutdown
values.description: We received a Shutdown notification.

values.description: Session hosts with an assigned user will be started during Ramp Up

values.description: All personal session hosts in the hostpool will be started during ramp up.

values.name: Available
values.description: Session Host has passed all the health checks and is available to handle connections.

values.name: Unavailable
values.description: Session Host is either turned off or has failed critical health checks which is causing service not to be able to route connections to this session host. Note this replaces previous 'NoHeartBeat' status.

values.name: Shutdown
values.description: Session Host is shutdown - RD Agent reported session host to be stopped or deallocated.

values.name: Disconnected
values.description: The Session Host is unavailable because it is currently disconnected.

values.name: Upgrading
values.description: Session Host is unavailable because currently an upgrade of RDAgent/side-by-side stack is in progress. Note: this state will be removed once the upgrade completes and the host is able to accept connections.

values.name: UpgradeFailed
values.description: Session Host is unavailable because the critical component upgrade (agent, side-by-side stack, etc.) failed.

values.name: NoHeartbeat
values.description: The Session Host is not heart beating.

values.name: NotJoinedToDomain
values.description: SessionHost is not joined to domain.

values.name: DomainTrustRelationshipLost
values.description: SessionHost's domain trust relationship lost

values.name: SxSStackListenerNotReady
values.description: SxS stack installed on the SessionHost is not ready to receive connections.

values.name: FSLogixNotHealthy
values.description: FSLogix is in an unhealthy state on the session host.

values.name: NeedsAssistance
values.description: New status to inform admins that the health on their endpoint needs to be fixed. The connections might not fail, as these issues are not fatal.
